mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, John Augustine Washington III to Jane C. Washington, 1842 March 7
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, John Augustine, III, 1821-1861
mdRecord.dcterms:description: John A. Washington writes to his mother about Gabriel Johnson, an enslaved man who has run away. Washington suspects Gabriel has gone to Jefferson County, where Jane is. In the letter, he also discusses work at the fishery and on the farm. Jane replies on March 11, 1842 to say that Gabriel has arrived at her plantation in Jefferson County. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, with integral address panel.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Fugitive slaves--Virginia
Johnson Gabriel, 1820-
